intro: Tibouchina caatingae, commonly known as the caatinga hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil's semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tibouchina caatingae thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
